timeline.message:
Issue #4520 Reinstate throw of UnreadableSessionDataException

Signed-off-by: Jan Bartel <janb@webtide.com>

timeline.bodyText: Since now you are rethrowing the exception, you don't want to log it at warn level at 370 - otherwise it will be printed out twice.
timeline.author: sbordet
sbordet
sbordet

replies.bodyText: Please add a comment here about the fact that since the session has been deleted, its id cannot be reused, and delete the javadoc of the method (which basically says the same, but in the wrong spot - and who reads test javadocs anyway?!? 😄)
replies.author: sbordet

timeline.author: sbordet
sbordet
sbordet
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -334,12 +335,13 @@ public Session get(String id) throws Exception
      * 
      * @param id The session to retrieve
      * @param enter if true, the usage count of the session will be incremented
-     * @return
-     * @throws Exception
+     * @return the session if it exists, null otherwise
+     * @throws Exception if the session cannot be loaded
      */
     protected Session getAndEnter(String id, boolean enter) throws Exception
     {
         Session session = null;
+        final AtomicReference<Exception> exception = new AtomicReference<Exception>();

timeline.bodyText: Perhaps you can just use _data in the implementation, so you won't need to remember deleted ids.
timeline.author: sbordet
